FERGIE.raw_line: Heavenly Haven. Sounds nice.Right down there... I think that's Heavenly Haven. NC such luck. The craft BANKS.Still better than prison. BR.'.-TA':-TAT! Suddenly GUNFIRE erupts all around him. He looksMe, a Judge, no, no -Look, I'm out on parole - If I get into any trouble my ass is right back in Aspen - CLICK. Zed's gun is in his face. FERGIE Let's go, Haven, Let's go Haven, Haven all the way - BANANA CLIPS are shoved into his hands along with boxes of :artridaes.Looks at his crazed "friends" and then backs up to the robot...Come on, give me a break, Judge uh-.Five years? But - I - I had no choice, judge - He sees Dredd's impassive face, turns to Hershey's more sympathetic one.They were killing each other up there, I had to get out! I only hacked the droid to save my life! It was the only way!Sixty stories? It woulda been suicide!Dredd? What are you doing here?That makes two Â©f us.Proper? Five years just for saving my own ass? .It was a mistake!Yeah? Then how do you explain what happened to you?Actually,Let's try it again, Dredd. You're in chains. You're going to prison. But you're innocent, and I'm guilty. But it's still not a mistake?W-wha -The stabilizers controls! They got hit, toot CAMERA RAKES to the control panel... and a SMOKING, SIZZLING section. The craft tilts alarmingly. Dredd grabs the stick, helps Fergie try and pull up. It's useless.Ohmigod, I'm dead. I'm dead!Amen, brother! Say it!Go tell it on the Mountain!Well, Dredd. The Law doesn't make mistakes, but I'm in like a disk, and you're toast.I'm not succulent! I'm not succulent, look, I'm skin and - CRACK! Dredd has swung his legs up, wrapped them around the pole, and SNAPPED it! He and the pole fall on top of Fergie and the leadmost Angels!I surrender! I surrender!We did it! We got them all! A SHAPE lunges up, close to CAMERA. It's one of the Hunters Dredd took out earlier, still alive enough to aim his weapon! Dredd aims his stolen one his trigger - CLICK! Empty! The Hunter squeezes Hunter turns - SLAM! The Hunter himself is hit! Shocked, the - gets off one last SHOT -I buried him. Except for this. Dredd silently follows Fergie to the grave. Fergie shoves the Remington into the mound of earth as a marker.You wanna... say something? He hands The Book to Dredd. After a moment, Dredd opens it.And these Cursed Earthers, they made it through? , _What's wrong? Are you kidding? Did that helmet you wore all those years compress your brain? You're gonna get me killed!There's one loose out here, too! Big choice, I got! Dying of thirst or from a fireball up my ass! This is all your fault!Yes! If you hadn't arrested me, wouldn't be here in the first place! =erc a sits down petulantly. FERGIE I'm through schlepping. I'm gonna sit here until I die... or until you apologize.You're not a Judge anymore.Apology accepted. Dredd turns... walks. Fergie looks at another FIREBALL emerging from the city wall.. then at the trackless wasteland he's just crossed. Pause. With a groan, he races to catch up with Dredd.Thirty... twenty nine... twenty eight... twenty seven... twenty six.. twenty five... _ 9 9 r,:ti : _I ? E... ND THEM 199 =e:gie's already beginning to drop back. The only guide in the dark is the slight reflection from CONDUIT on the chute floor.I'm alive. I'm alive! (seeing Dredd, lessBut Fargo said you couldn't trustJust don't get us killed, Dredd. : still want that apology.Dredd! Tell them I'm innocent!Dredd..? Dredd, you're not gonna-- Dredd hits the button marked "AERIAL MODE". There's a BEEP and the SOUND FX we heard earlier... when the flying prototype failed.I guess you're out of friends, Dredd.I'm with him. - =141; steps into the light.You can forget the terminal out here. We're gonna have to go somewhere else to get in the System.Central's a fuzzy A.I. - the best fuzzy A.I. ever built. If reasoning didn't work... .nothing will.Simple systems, Dredd! Besides, I was scared.Well, yeah. Those were life or death situations. That's when my adrenalin shoots up and my brain goes into overtime - but you can't predict when that's gonna - Dredd grabs him, tucks him under his arm like a newspaper, and leaves the pod.Hey! The others are so surprised it's a second before they follow.Dredd, have you gone craz- OW! Dredd steers him into another hanging FIXTURE. And ANOTHER.Dredd! Stop it - OW! Are you out of your - OW !Damn it, Dredd, Lemme down! I'm hitting every Goddamn - 2ï¿½C ice:- - CLOSE 250 ï¿½.. :his position, we can SEE the flash of inspiration on s "ace.- light!Have it show you the city power grid!Tell it to scan around all the grid sections. Random selection.This looks like a really bad neighborhood. I'll stay here and watch the bike -I. knew you were gonna say that.hangs on to the robot as it staggers around, trying to regain control of its own movements. It stumbles back out into the corridor. Fergie sees it's reaching for him! Desperate, Fergie reaches into the robot as far as he can, throws a SWITCH! ZAP!Hack you... asshole. =ercï¿½e slumps... lies still.And you'll never arrest me again.Damn straight. e dies. Dredd closes his eyes. CAMERA TIGHTENS on Dredd as nis face fills with fury. He SEES Hershey's Lawgiver on the --cor. Snatches it up! We CRANE UP with him as he COCKS it.

HERSHEY.raw_line: Take cover!This isn't a Sim, Rookie! Stand down and wait for back up! In position outside Heavenly Haven. Pinned down by fire from upper floors.Fire is coming from Level Y, repeat Y. Request back-up, nearest Judge! The map BEEPS, shows a route. The hand moves to the THROTTLE.If that's who I think it is... he does.Down! You crazy futz - !I was supposed to watch out for him.He might have been telling the truth. Haven't you ever heard of extenuating circumstances?Forget it, Olmeyer. I'm not gonna be the yearbook Centerfold!No, let me show yoou a dummy. She turns his head so he can SEE his reflection. When he turns back - she's gone.Judge Dredd? He looks at her, waiting.Well, I think your truth is relative. I have a personal life. I have lots-of friends.It's not that bad.Uh, well, my class is young. None of them have found the right... person. e lust looks at her.Has it really been like that for you? Haven't you ever been in -What happened?Judge Hunters? Then it's a full trial before the Council... that only happens one in a generation...You're under.indictment? For what?Objection, Your Honor. This video is inadmissible as evidence.That is the State's interpretation. Replay dialogue. _ï¿½EC rewinds. Then:Stop video. Do you hear it? When Lily Hammond says "Dredd", it's part of the conversation. And when Vardis Hammond,,sa s 'Dredd' it could just as easily be the same. The suggestion that either has recognized their murderer is sheer supposition... or, in the case of the prosecution, wishful-thinking! BIG REACTION from the packed room. Griffin bangs the gavel for silence.You only picked me because you didn't have anyone else.It clearly shows nothing!Cadet Olmeyer is acknowledged by all his instructors to be an expert in the field of still and video graphics. His affidavit states that this surveillance video is of such low definition that even after all known enhancements are used, no positive identification can be made of the killer. Since the uniform of a Judge could be counterfeit, I repeat my objection to this video being entered as evidence in this case. I ask for a ruling.returns to the defendant's table as the court quiets down. Olmeyer WHOOPS a second longer than everyone else. Embarrassed, he quiets down, but not before Dredd notices him.,Trust me. It's not your ass he's interested in.DNA evidence is irrefutable!Your Honor... the defense rests.Dredd. I... I'm sorry.Dredd..!Well. Baby Dredd.Central, I need to access the graphics database.This should be a little faster: I want you to ID this man.Central? Central? Hello?The Dance? You want me to go to the Go amn Junior Dance?We're trying to save Judge Dredd, and you're using the situation to blackmail me. That's disgraceful!Yes!Yes! Just do'it!Olmeyer, you stupid futz! You analyzed the wrong picture!You were supposed to do this one! You just wasted three hours! c-_rrputer BEEPS. MESSAGES run by the bottom of the screen.What?You mean... it's not real?Dispatch, I'm in Green Quad, 4-11. Need pickup.Yes, patch me in!You can start by telling me why Dredd's baby picture is a state secret. Pause. We can almost hear Central thinking. Meanwhile, behind Hershey, a figure in a Judge's uniform approaches her Bike... drops something into a storage compartment on it. Even from this distance we notice a red arming light on the object.Up against the wall, now! The figure complies. It's Fergie.Dredd! '_- a moment she's elated. Then her face hardens. She holds n steady. HERSHEY Stay where you are.They're dying out-there, Dredd. A hundred and eight Judges in 48 hours. Everyone who's left is on triple shifts and pseudorphin. I thought it was organized criminals, revolutionaries, something... then I was a target.I don't know what to think anymore. Dredd moves like lightning - pins her gun hand against the wall - then freezes. It's a challenge, not a threat. She glares at him - counter moves - gets an elbow against his throat! But Dredd doesn't break her hold - or turn the gun on her. It's deliberate check-mate on both their parts.Secrets can hurt more than anything. She relaxes her hold on him. Throws something down.Tell me about him, Dredd. Make me believe in you again the way I did when I defended you.And he's doing it again?Griffin? We have to tell the Council - !She's been on her feet for days and this is the last psychic blow. She sags. Dredd catches her.No!Dredd. The Janus project didn't do that to you. You did that to yourself. He turns, startled. Realizes she's right.Never the Law, Dredd. Never the Law. That means more than anything else she can say to him. He looks into her eyes. Fergie comes in, ends the moment.I'd be honored. Dredd reaches over, squeezes her hand. There's absolutely nc:n.nc sexual about it - and that makes it even more powerful.Central. This is Judge Hershey. I hereby file formal charges of murder against Chief Justice Griffin and Council Judge Rico. And I order you to give me the location of the Janus Lab so that I may personally make the arrest!Dredd, you're scaring him!Central! I need to see the city power grid!Scan through all the grid sections. Random selection. RAPID IMAGES now: Different neighborhoods of Mega-City, all depicted as COMPUTER GRAPHICS of color and pattern.What about you -Down there. CAMERA ZOOMS BACK. They're on the artiall ruined HEAD of the STATUE OF LIBERTY! Now, t ey DESCEND into the torso.Dredd! Catch! She throws the Remington â¢11sa dropped to Dredd!You don't fight girls much, do you? She grabs Ilsa's ankle, flips her!Judge Bitch, to you! Hershey CLOBBERS her with a right!Grenade. BLAM! The incubators EXPLODE.

DREDD.raw_line: strides calmly over to them.He's firing a 64 laze pumper from six hundred feet. He couldn't hit me if I painted a bull's eye on my ass.You - last. Dredd pushes Brisco behind Hershey. Turns toward Heavenly as re draws his massive LAWGIVER HANDGUN. Dredd speaks into the ::ny computer in the breech as he aims at the door.Grenade. :'ï¿½BccM! The round knocks the steel door off its hinges. Dredd r:zxs :z aside and the Judges enter.No. There.This room is pacified. mcves carefully through the smoke. Behind him, Hershey andspins around. Sees Brisco dead in the doorway. Snarls, enraged. Hershey whirls, KICKS down one of the wounded who tries to escape in the confusion.You're all under arrest. Will you surrender, or would you like your trials now? 7ne', look at him for a moment - then BLAST away.Mega-City Municipal Code 334.8. Willful destruction of property. That's two years. WHAR:. He hits Zed in the face. Zed rocks, but stays up. He fries tc grab a nearby weapon, but Dredd kicks it away.Code 11-5C. Illegal possession of assault weapons. Five years. Zed blocks Dredd's next blow; pulls him into a brutal embrace, slams Dredd against the walf. Again!Code 7034-A. Resisting arrest. Twenty years. Dredd breaks free! Slams Zed once, twice. Zed flies back against the wall.9804. Assault on a Judge with deadly intent.No... Death. He FIRES at the same moment as Zed! Zed's shot hits Dredd's ARMOR, pings off. Dredd's shot hits Zed's heart.Court is adjourned.He made the mistake. Not you. Dredd cocks his head, listening. Somehow in the din and confusion he has heard something. He turns.The guide wire in the floor isn't working. Five! Four!Mega-City Municipal Code 1286.4: Willful sabotage of a public servo-droid. That's six months, citizen. He grabs Fergie, pushes him against the wall.- Let's see your Unicard.FERGUSON, Herman. Forget six months: You've hacked into city droids, computers... Cash machines, robot taxis... And you haven't even been out of jail for twenty four hours.Not at all. You could have climbed out a window, worked your way down. Or found a turboshaft and shimmied down the cable.Maybe. But it would have been legal. I sentence you to five years in. Aspen Penitentiary. Case closed. Take him away. s-': protesting, Fergie is hauled away. Hershey looks at Dredd.A rookie Judge died there, too. I guess he wasn't worth mentioning.Chief Justice?They were unavoidable, sir. Out there... that's the reality.With all due respect, sir, how can you say that when you spend most of your time - D edd breaks off; he's said too much. But Fargo won't let him she hook.At the Academy... Sir.It.. doesn't matter what they say, Sir. You're the.Chief Justice of Mega City. If rt weren't for you and the others like you, we wouldn't have our justice system. There isn't a Judge in Mega-City who doesn't want to follow in your footsteps.Kevlar nine helmet and body armor. WIDEN. Dredd is LECTURING to a group of CADETS who hang on his every word. We're in a TRAINING AREA like the one "Q" ran in the Bond movies. Dredd turns. A TECH nods: Target ready. Dredd FIRES a barrage of bullets at a mannequin in Judge's gear. The bullets ricochet off. The class OOOHS and AHHS.Yours, when you graduate.Lawgiver Two. Twenty five round sidearm with mission-variable voice programmed ammunition.Yours, when you graduate.Mark IV Lawmaster, improved model. With on-board cannon, vertical take off and landing,. flight capacity and 500 kilometer range. The head Tech gives thumbs up while the other techs step back. The class waits, expectant. The lead tech throws a REMOTE. SPARKS fly. The motor COUGHS, dies. The class GROANS. Dredd glares at the embarrassed technicians.Yours... if they ever get it to work. LAUGHTER. Dredd moves to a lectern. Faces the class.All of these things are nothing but toys. Bottom line, final word, end of the day, when you're alone in the dark... all that counts... is this. takes something from the lectern shelf, throws it down. It's all-but holy book: THE LAW.And you will be alone. Because when you swear to uphold these ideals, you are sacrificing whatever chance you have for a Life. h T e': Frown; this is not what they expected to hear from a legend. They become increasingly unnerved.Life, Liberty, and the Pursuitof Happiness. Old and noble ideas. But they are what we give to (Xi others... not what we will ever receive for ourselves. Class dismissed. The class breaks up on a definite low note.Really. How long since you saw any of them?You've only been on the street a year. You're still in denial.How many married Judges do you know?Yes. Once.Is this your car?Of course not. Towing is the penalty for the first offense. This is your second violation. Grenade.They're Judge Hunters, Hershey. They're the ones who come out when a Judge has broken the Law. Hershey reacts; she's heard of them.Judge Hershey. I don't have anyone else to ask... Will... will you be my defense attorney?Murder. (XThat is the Law, Judge McGruder. I would expect no less.Judge Hershey. I'm really glad I picked you to defend me.I'm still glad. CAMERA FOLLOWS Hershey forward.That kid barely knows me and he wants to save my ass.Do your job. She nods, stands.You did your best, Judge Hershey. He stands, takes her hand.Thank you.Okay. W::.h a SNAP and without looking, Dredd jerks his elbow ba_xwards. The prisoner is knocked unconscious. As he sags in .is :hains, CAMERA ADJUSTS. The prisoner on the side of Dredd we haven't seen is Fergie. Now, he stares at Dredd. Then pins his hands over Dredd's.face, leaving Dre 's jaw =xï¿½cs and parting his fingers at Dredd's eyes, like the visor in she Judge's helmet. Fergie's eyes go wide.I was convicted of a crime.No. You got the sentence the Law required. The Proper sentence.The Law does not make mistakes.No.Look out - Misunderstanding his intentions, the nearest guardZAPS him with his Stun Club! At the same moment, Pa Angel getsthe other guard's weapon, turns it on him! The guard DROPS.One of theHack the Shuttle!Hack the shuttle, now! Fergie pushes the pilot's body aside, hits controls. Meanwhile the convicts are swarming against the cage door.What the hell's wrong?Rico? That's impossible... O.S. SCREAM. Fergie wakes with a start, REACTS to the dramatic shafts of sunlight raking the cathedral ceiling.You have just committed murder. The penalty isdeath. Reverend Angel HITS Dredd.Ah... Fergie...Actually, youre toast: I arrested the Angels oar Cannibalism.Fargo? BLOOD wells on Fargo's coat. e's been hit. As he sags, Dredd and Fergie rush towards him.HNo. You and the first Judges... you saved Mega-City.But.., but the orphanage told me my parents were killed by lawbreakers -- they gave me that picture of them -What do you mean, both times?I have a... brother?Like I trusted you?To find Rico.There's a way in: Six years ago two Cursed Earthers figured it out.The vent from the city incinerator. There's a burst twice a minute. That means that there's 30 seconds for someone to run through the tube before it flames again.Actually, they were burned to a crisp. But the theory's sound.Fergie. There's a maniac loose in the city -My fault?Run! C=ouched over, they race up the slight slope.Stop counting!FAINT light starts to fall on him. 'Then he SEES it, up ahead -the lights of Mega-City! Dredd pushes on - reaches the opening! Turns to look at..,-Fergie? Dredd hears a muffled SOUND beneath him. He reaches down... YANKS Fergie into view. Fergie spits out a mouthful of ashes.I don't. But I trust the Council. When I tell them about Rico...You're mine.Hershey. What is it - ?You think I'm-part of this -Him... and Griffin.The same. Inhuman. Defective. He just broke down, first.How many times have you said I had no feelings, no emotions? Now you know why.It's not the same! They had parents, they embraced their humanity... they didn't hide it... fight it... question it!Myself. Griffin. Fargo. Even Fergie. I've been wrong about so much...Hershey. You just said I was never wrong about the Law. They took away my badge. I'm a convicted murderer. I have no authority any more - no legal authority. Pause. without the law as a safety net, Dredd is in uncharted emotional territory.Will ...wi11 you help me, Hershey? Not as a Judge but... but... as my friend? ::'s the most ordinary request anyone could make... anyone but Dredd. Hershey understands how much it means. She fights back :ears, puts her hand on his arm.You're helping them?But they're breaking the law! Who the hell programmed you?Fine! I'll file charges!Fergie, you've got to have something - a password, a kluge -Come on, you cracked the food robot... the shuttle computer -Scared..?First that Goddamn computer turned on me. Then, you! CRASH! Fergie's head hits a LIGHT FIXTURE. The bulb EXPLODES.That's the idea! Another BULB EXPLODES.The Lab was top secret. It had to be in an out of the way place to stay secret. Right?Red Quad, Section 5: The oldest part of Mega-City. Olmeyer turns, looks off.What?No. Edsel, here still has anotherI'm nothing like you.You get nothing from me, Rico. You've betrayed the Law.When Aspen thaws, Rico. Go to hell. Tense seconds. Rico grins boyishly, lowers the gun.Fergie.I. I made a mistake. I... I'm sorry I misjudged you.And I'll never arrest you again.The round HITS HIM like a pile driver! His SHIRT catches FIRE! He falls backwards over a railing as the SMOKE coils upwards!Central! Can you -Okay, you win. I'll give myself up to Chief Justice Rico. Where is he?That's for Fargo! That's for the u Co ncil! That's for Fergie!Signal Flare! And as he SHOUTS it, he uses his last strength to smack the weapon away!.. It's over.No. Just a Judge. I did my job. CAMERA ADJUSTS and we SEE that he is holding Fergie's body in ..z.s arms.Here's your hero. The other Judges take Fergie's body respectfully. Hershey and -ever approach Dredd.

MCGRUDER.raw_line: - of your misguided policies as Urban Administrator!Before we go on, I wish to make a personal comment.The video you have just seen is prima fascia evidence that the defendant is guilty as charged. Mark this video People's ExhibitJudge Hershey, are you serious? Both of them recognized Judge Dredd!Your Honor. I am forced now to enter certain technical evidence of a critical nature regarding the Mega-City Legal system.â¢I will need the Court's permission. I will also need permission to access the Central Computer Bank.Central. I wish to access weapons schematics, Judges division. Describe the workings of the standard Judge's sidearm, the Lawgiver Two, and especially its improvements over the earlier Lawgiver One. Central SPEAKS. Somehow its monotonous, sexless voice hints at an actual personality.Central. Were the bullets recovered from the bodies of Vardis and Lily Hammond so DNA coded?And what was the result of the computer check of the DNA coding on those bullets? :ould swear that the computer is going for drama.Your Honor, the Prosecution rests.Whoever's doing it knows all our procedures... our security measures...even our scrambled frequencies - !We can't replaee those Judges! it takes years of training! We may never be at full strength again!Who knows if it's safe?You aren't considering this madness?I agree. Judge Griffin, please restore the Security Blocks.Griffin, this is treason! You just sealed your fate!

FARGO.raw_line: Order, order! As presiding Justice, I only vote to break a tie. But I wish to address the question of Judge Griffin's crime package. Is there any objection?This body is not the first assembly That delusion has been tried and failed before. If the citizens of Mega-City are demanding more control of their lives, that's not a threat - it's a signal! A signal to open the windows of our society and let it: breathe - Not to bolt the door and throw away the key! My fellow Judges, I was barely in my teens when I put on this badge. When the time comes for me to take it off... let me do it. knowing that it stood for Freedom... and not for Repression. He sits down. Clearly he has changed the mood of the room.Four Summary Executions, Dredd. Were they necessary?Most of my time where?Don't you mean at the Academy wiping Cadet's Asses? That is what they say in the squad room, isn't it?I'm glad you feel that way, Dredd. Because starting tomorrow you're going to spend one day a week at the Academy... teaching. Dredd takes this in his stride.Ethics. And as Dredd reacts, weDredd. I... I can't believe it...Is it possible? Dredd, homicidal too? We went through.this nine years ago...How... how long have you known?Into oblivion? You're suggesting I take it? You-fiust really want to destroy me -My Walk will give you the Chief Judgeship!Bury me there, under the blind lady. ^redd doesn't understand. Fargo raises his arm, points to the statue of Justice weighing her scales.Judge or citizen - everyone got a fair shake. She treated them all the same.Yes. And almost lost our souls. It seemed like,,a wise idea: Create the perfect Judge. Breed courage - wisdom - integrity. The Janus Project. We used the old Council for the base material. Five DNA samples were taken, two were chosen. One was mine.A fake. The psychs on the Janus project came up with that story. It was supposed to motivate you into law enforcement. It worked. Both times.More than a brother.He had to be put down . But I wouldn't let them do that to you. Griffin blackmailed me into the Walk, Dredd. Don't trust him.I'm sorry... son. The breath goes out of Fargo's body. He dies. Dredd stares at him, his world torn apart.

GRIFFIN.raw_line: This entire body owes its very existence to you, Chief Justice. = I can ' t imagine anyone having an objection. CAMERA sweeps towards Fargo, passing over the MAP of North America etched on t h e great DAIS. Only a few lights stand out on all the conti nent: MEGA-CITY ONE; MEGA-CITY TWO; TEXAS CITY; and the ASPEN PENAL C OLONY. All the rest is labeled THE CURSEDI'm afraid the evidence is conclusive. The trial will be just a formality. Fa:=c descends shakily from his seat. Moves to the window. :e =axes a pill from his pocket, tries to swallow it without ï¿½;_ _ f _ _r. seeingWe were able toâ¢hide the facts then. This time, we may not be so lucky.The victim was a reporter. The media is already sniffing around. Eventually... they'll get to the truth.About Janus... and your part in it.Does it matter?There's a way out, Chief Justice.No. I want to save the Judge system. The media won't stop digging into Dredd's case. When they get to the bottom... they'll find you.But if you take the Long Walk... they'll find nothing but your honored memory.It could also save Dredd's life.The Court shares in Judge McGruder's sentiments. In a way I am glad that Judge Fargo is about to begin his Long Walk.He will be spared the pain of this trial. Proceed, Judge McGruder.Objection... sustained. The video is inadmissib e.The Jury may be sequestered. The Foreman, COUNCIL JUDGE ESPOSITO, stands.Joseph Dredd, for this crime the Law allows only one punishment:However: I have here the last order of Judge Fargo, written this morning before he prepared for the Long Walk."Let his armor be taken from him, and all his garb of Justice..."Are you out of your mind, coming here? Griffin angrily starts forward... stops when the ABC robot moves to block his path.And you brought this, too? Griffin waves his hand over desk controls. The lights DIM. S:i TTERS block the windows.Yes, I know. Like framing Dredd for Hammond's murder.Hammond had to be silenced when he found out abut Janus! But I could have used Dredd! He practically worshiped the ground I walked on-There's a lot of work to be done.You'll see it soon enough. In the meantime... I want chaos, Rico. That block war was just the beginning. Now I want fear racing through every street... terror in every quad... panic in every block. Until those miserable rezzies think even their Judges can't save them. That's when the Council will turn to me... and to Janus. Rico moves towards the door. Pauses.You've made a lot of progress. Good.Leave that to me. Meanwhile you have work to do... on the streets.There is a solution. (on their desperateIf this wholesale slaughter of Judges continues, there won't be a council! Janus could -There's been over thirty years of genetic research since Janus failed. What if we could create adult subjects, fully grown andfu3ly trained at birth? We could replace the Judges we've lost in weeks. We could save our society!Griffin, Douglas. .Chief Justice. Authorize access-to file, code name "Janus".Password... Janus. moves in front of the mac hi ne, speaks tersely. GRIFFIN Central: Using current technology, how long would it take for Janus to produce a fully grown adult subject?I see, now, that none of you have the force of will that these terrible times require. You will never open Janus again. So... we'll just leave it... unlocked. 216r EXT. COUNCIL CHAMBER - NIGHT 216A Dredd is about to open the door when a HAND spins him around. It's the Judge who followed..him!No. You've just sealed yours. Rico!tries to get a shot at Dredd, can't. Then Griffin hears ALARMS, SHOUTS, running footsteps. Griffin steps quickly in, KICKS Dredd in the head.Really? s moment we think he's going to shoot. Then he turns his points it at his own arm - fires!Stop him! He just killed the entire council! Dredd realizes he's fucked. He turns, runs. The Judge Hunters pause near their wounded leader; who bravely waves them on. ^.ey tear after Dredd like woJ-ves.It's better with him on the loose. He'll keep the surviving street Judges preoccupied while we work on Janus.Excellent suggestion, Central. Do it.Dredd got away from the Hunters. He could be on his way here right now!My God. You?Rico. You don't know what you're doing! Software or wetware, when you make reproductions, there's always the danger of a defective copy! The last time, there was one perfect copy -Dredd! And one defective copy -Lou! You had a mutation, on the Y chromosone...A mutation that made you a genetic criminal!Rico, for God's sake, listen! You're a defective copy yourself! And now you're making more copies that will be even more mutated -moreMy God. I never should have started this. Never. But now I'll finish it - ï¿½. He draws his Lawgiver! But it has barely cleared the holster when the ABC robot grabs Griffin's wrist! It plucks the weapon from his han as if he's a child, hangs on to him!

RICO.raw_line: Have you come for another... chat?"Innocent"? A meaningless word. The innocent exist only until they inevitably become perpetrators themselves. In the end, "Guilt" and "Innocence" are merely a matter of timing.Am I? When did you become a perpetrator? Was it the time you found money mysteriously transferred into your account? Or the time I was sentenced to death? You've been taking bribes for years, Warden. You're a criminal. And a stupid one: You don't even know who's paying you.If ignorance is bliss, Warden, then you must be very blissful.The Ancient Puzzle, Miller: The One about the Meaning of Life.It's over. And he AIMS the "puzzle". BLAM!You're holding a package for me. I'm. Rick.I thought they destroyed all the ABC Warbots?Really? grabs it! Geiger flinches - then looks puzzled.How do you like that? He SHOOTS Geiger at point-blank range. Geiger hits the floor.I must be a Judge. Rico bends, takes Geiger's keys and his cigars... then goes to the big cage.Status: Personal bodyguard. Commander: Rico. Mission: We're going to war.I like to do things my way.Dredd only worships the Law. And he'd blow you away the minute he found out just how much you're pissing on it. Trust me: It's better this way. Let him see what it's like to freeze his ass off in Aspen. Let him see what it's like I to be me! After all... He moves closer to Griffin, smiles..Dredd and I have so much in common. Why not this? Griffin looks at him, decides to drop the subject.Yes. The Janus lab -Fear, Terror, Panic. I think I can handle that. After all... Look how quickly I brought fear in here. His smile fades and he exits.Hello, Professor.I see you're still researching the dark night of the soul.Don't go woosy on me, Professor. We got work to do. He puts his arm around her. They step over her victim on their way out.Come on, you piece of junk... No offense. The bolt loosens. Rico can open the panel. RICO Let there be Light. He flips a switch. The OVERHEAD LIGHTS come on.Tomorrow. But it won't mean a thing if you can't get into Central's Janus files. They're still security locked."Fear, Terror, Panic." Yes. My favorite emotions.C'mon, Fido. Walkies. The robot follows Rico and Ilsa out the door. Griffin watchesWho says politics is boring?Why didn't you kill him when you had the chance?Central... I'm touched.Slight change,. of plans, Central. I want to purge that DNA sample.The same thing you are: House-cleaning. Mock-annoyed, she throws a cleaning rag at him. She turns on he droid. It moves off, polishing the floor. Curious, she icins Rico.Central, active the DNA sampling console. :4-nind Rico, another CONSOLE lights up. Rico crosses to it, passing by his pet robot. v:: _ .. R : CO 24Don't worry. He's going to be seriously outnumbered. Right, Central?Hey, That old DNA was in there for over 30 years. Sooner or later you gotta clean out the fridge.Can you think of a better model? Sleek lines... strong chassis. Corners on the curves.Me.Yes. A mutat;on that made me the next step in human evolution.Really? What's your excuse?You're lying! All you care about is control! Well, the next batch of Janus Judges won't be the puppets you want... they'll be my brothers and sisters, mine to control!Why not? I'm going to breed some more of me... the old fashioned way.You will be.Griffy. You shouldn't have done that. Fido is very loyal.That's right, Griff. You gotta get with this hi-tech stuff. Robot: Tear off Judge Griffin's arms and legs. Save his head for last. CAMERA ADJUSTS as Griffin SCREAMS with fear - and then, as we :GHTEN on Rico and Ilsa, and we SEE the horrible SHADOWS on t:ne wall, the screams become far, far worse. cc watches with wincing amusement, like a spectator at a par: cularly rough hockey game. :=sa watches with a sick fascination and awe. -:-:ally the screams and horrible wrenching sounds STOP. There's a T The robot returns to position, metal hands stained.You may so assume.Let's start with... a thousand. CAMERA ADJUSTS to show the INCUBATORS as they begin to fill withEnough. Dredd. Drop your gun.Amusing. Robot. On a count of three... break Judge Hershey's neck. One... two... .e.: groaning, the Robot STANDS - tenses. Dredd throws down Remington beside Hershey's Lawgiver. Ilsa comes over to the V:ea=c^s. She picks up the REMINGTON... starts to reach for theShe's such a tease.He is a lot like me.The only difference between us, Joseph, is that you destroyed your life when you embraced the Law. I destroyed the Law and embraced...- life !This is where we were born, brother! Can you feel the magic? Come... come, see where we began.Look at them. Full of promise. The dawn of the new day.The dawn of a new species.Our brothers and sisters will be born in two hours. 60 today... 60 tomorrow. An endless supply of perfection to guard Mega-City forever. Dredd. I can't train them alone... wide them alone. You can help me. You have to help me: It's your birthright.You... you dare mention betrayal to me? I was your friend. More then a friend! I was oyal to you... and you Judged me! You sent me up for nine years o frozen hell in Aspen! And you dare say "betrayal" to me? He raises his Lawgiver, aims it between Dredd's eyes.Dredd. Give me your word you'll help me raise the kids.Aw. You knew I couldn't pull the trigger. we're family. He steps back. His face hardens. He SHOUTS.Fido!Central! Hatch the first set of clones, now!Fuck that, I need reinforcements! Hatch the Goddamn clones, now!whirls at the SHOT. FIRES at the muzzle flash! We HEAR a GROAN and a THUD. Grinning, Rico races in that direction.Central! Turn off overhead lighting! HUNK. The lights GO OUT. Rico grins, runs out of SHOT!This... this is how you repay me for telling you the truth? That we were born with a destiny to rule! A destiny you spit on! Rico hits him on the wound again! Dredd falls, rolls to the edge of the rubble strewn platform. Rico grins, struggles to full height. RICOAnd finally... to the charge of being human when you could have been a God... GUILTY. Rico nicks up the Lawgiver. Puts it right against Dredd's head.The sentence is DEATH!

CENTRAL.raw_line: One moment.Nine years ago, the Lawgiver Model Two replaced the Lawgiver Model One. The difference lies in two areas: The computer chip and the ammunition coding. Like the Model one, the computer chip recognizes the thumbcode of all Judges. Judges may use each other's firearms; but a suspect dare not use a Judge's .weapon against "a Judge. ANIMATION reminds us of this in non-gory fashion.However, the ammunition coding in the Model Two is not cued to the thumbcode recognition chip. Instead, it is coded to the personal DNA of the Judge using the weapon.Yes, Judge McGruder. It could not be otherwise.The DNA is a perfect match for Judge Joseph--D-re--dd. _:iAMSER - WIDE SHOTThat could take several days, Judge Hershey. The Graphic Database covers all known graphics, from the Paleoithic Era to today. Hershey opens the framed viewies she took from Dredd's apartment, slides out the one with the adult Dredd.Even from here, I can see it's Judge Dredd.Scanning for identity, unknown male, approximately 200 Cm. tall, weighing 95 kilos, Skin Tone Three. Ten. Nine. Eight. Seven. Six - Suddenly the CONSOLE GOES DEAD with a BEEP.I'm sorry, I can neither confirm nor deny your statement.Acknowledged.Acknowledged. ON SCREEN, GRAPHICS show the SOFTWARE LOCKS being removed one by one from the Janus Files.Acknowledged.I have unanimous authorization for access to file, code name "Janus". Removing security blocks. .NOW. Awaiting Password command from Presiding Chief Justice.Given the current state of genetic engineering an adult subject could be incubated in approximately eight hours. ASTONISHMENT in the room.Although only two subjects were produced in the original experiment, the laboratory was equipped with 20 incubators. if fully operational, 420 subjects could be produced a week.It's done. Council Judge Rico, may be the first to offer my congratulations?DNA sample purged. If you wish to proceed with cloning, I will require a new sample.The sampling console is ready. rips his sleeve open to the elbow... sits down... puts his _.:rnec arm in a special steel hollow. CHUNG! CLAMPS close, ._s arm down. RICO Central. Take DNA sample.. .now. DRILL LIKE DEVICE descends with a frightening grind -anc STABS right into his arm!New DNA sample being analyzed. Scanning. Ma;rix scan complete.I am sorry, but the location of the Janus Lab is classified information, accessible only to Chief Justice Griffin and Council Judge Rico.Actually, the onl Council Judge. Chief Justice Griffin promoted him so they could both use me to get the Janus Lab up and running.Lawyers.Certainly, Judge Hershey. However, as per Mega-City Code Section 84, Paragraph "A", I need authorization from the Chief Justice to arrest a Council Judge. Similarly, as stated in Paragraph "B", same Section, I need authorization from any Council Judges to arrest a Chief Justice. In this case, that would be Chief Judge Griffin and Council Judge Rico.Basically... yes. And without their authorization you cannot file charges, and without charges I cannot violate Security and tell you the location of the Lab.It's probably just the Judge Hunters.When I was off-line a moment ago, Judge Griffin asked me if I knew where you were. Naturally, I told him yes, and gave him your location.I'm sorry, Chief Justice. The ABC robot is not tied into my main processor. Judge Rico has sole voice control.Before we go on, um... may I assume that Judge Griffin has uh... retired from duty?The clone incubators are on-line. The first batch of clones from your personal DNA can be hatched in eight hours. Chief Justice Rico, how many copies of you would you like?The cloning process is not finished, Chief Justice Rico. The Clones will be only 60 per cent complete.Beginning hatching process... now.Don't expect help from me, escaped-convict Dredd. I have explained your legal standing repeatedly. I advise you to surrender.
